thread.title: Miami fires Al Golden after worst loss in program history
thread.title_full: Miami fires Al Golden after worst loss in program history

author: TIM REYNOLDS
title: Miami fires Al Golden after worst loss in program history
text:
Wilfredo Lee Miami fires Al Golden after worst loss in program history 
Miami head coach Al Golden watches a play during the first half of an NCAA College football game against Clemson, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015 in Miami Gardens, Fla. There was booing and a "Fire Golden" chant from the sparse crowd even before the first quarter ended, and the stands were largely empty by the midpoint of the third quarter as Clemson defeated Miami 58-0. (AP Photo/Wilfredo Lee) Posted: Sunday, October 25, 2015 9:28 pm | Updated: 10:45 pm, Sun Oct 25, 2015. Miami fires Al Golden after worst loss in program history Associated Press | 
CORAL GABLES, Fla. (AP) — The worst loss in Miami's storied history will be Al Golden's last with the Hurricanes. 
In a move that long seemed inevitable, Golden was fired Sunday with more than four full years left on his contract. Tight ends coach Larry Scott will take over as interim head coach, as the Hurricanes try to save their season and take another run at trying to reclaim lost prominence.
